db

Class QueriesDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • db.QueriesDB

  • public class QueriesDB
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the queries needed for the application to communicate with the database.

    Contains the methods needed for the initialization of the cache memory.

    Methods updating the database also update the cache memory.

      • QueriesDB

        public QueriesDB()

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Gets the JDBC connection.
        Returns:
        the JDBC connection

      • freeResources

        public void freeResources(java.sql.Connection con,
                 java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt,
                 java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Free JDBC resources.
        Parameters:
        con - the JDBC connection
        stmt - the prepared statement
        rs - the result set

      • insertSoftwareAgent

        public void insertSoftwareAgent(RegisterInfo regInfo)
        Inserts the Software Agent into the database and cache memory ( does nothing if already exists )

        The new agent:

        • is considered unconfirmed.
        • is inserted in the Cache.pendingMap .
        Parameters:
        regInfo - the registration info of Software Agent

      • checkAccepted

        public java.lang.Boolean checkAccepted(java.lang.String hashKey)
        Checks if Software Agent indicated by the hashkey is accepted. ( by checking the Cache.acceptedMap )
        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key
        Returns:
        true if is accepted, otherwise false

      • getSoftwareAgents

        public void getSoftwareAgents()
        Fills the cache memory with confirmed Software Agents from the database.

        The results are stored in Cache.acceptedMap

      • getSentJobs

        public void getSentJobs()
        Fills the cache memory with the sent jobs from the database.

        Periodic jobs are stored in Cache.periodicMap

        One time jobs are stored in Cache.onetimeMap

      • insertJobs

        public void insertJobs(java.lang.String hashKey,
              Wrapper<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> jobs)
        Inserts a map of jobs into the database and cache memory.

        Jobs are also stored in Cache.addMap

        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key
        jobs - a map representing the jobs

      • getAddJobs

        public void getAddJobs()
        Fills the cache memory with the newly added jobs from the database.

        Jobs are stored in Cache.addMap

      • updateJobs

        public void updateJobs(java.lang.String hashKey)
        Updates the jobs' sent status to "true into database and cache."

        The updated jobs:

        • are removed from Cache.addMap.
        • are inserted in the Cache.periodicMap and Cache.onetimeMap respectively.
        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key

      • deleteJob

        public void deleteJob(java.lang.String hashKey,
             java.lang.String idJob)
        Deletes a job based on its ID from database and cache memory.

        The job's flags field is updated to "Stop".

        The job is deleted from Cache.periodicMap.

        The job is added to Cache.addMap.

        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key
        idJob - the job id

      • terminateSoftwareAgent

        public void terminateSoftwareAgent(java.lang.String hashKey)
        Terminates a Software Agent by assigning an exiting job.

        If the job does not exit, creates a nmap job with id = -1, flags = "exit(0), periodic = true, periodicTime = -1".

        If the job exists, the flags field is updated to "exit(0)".

        The job is deleted from Cache.periodicMap.

        The job is added to Cache.addMap.

        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key

      • updateLastRequest

        public void updateLastRequest(java.lang.String hashKey)
        Updates the last request time of a Software Agent with the current timestamp into the database and cache memory.

        Agent in Cache.acceptedMap is also updated.

        Parameters:
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key

      • connectUser

        public boolean connectUser(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Validates the login info of a user.
        Parameters:
        username - the username
        password - the password
        Returns:
        true if info is valid, otherwise false

      • getUnconfirmedSA

        public void getUnconfirmedSA()
        Fills the cache memory with the unconfirmed Software Agents.

        The results are stored in Cache.pendingMap.

      • acceptORdeclineSoftwareAgent

        public void acceptORdeclineSoftwareAgent(boolean accept,
                                int hashKey)
        Accept or decline a Software Agent.

        The agent:

        • gets deleted from Cache.pendingMap.
        • if accepted, becomes confirmed and stored in Cache.acceptedMap.
        • if declined, gets deleted from database.
        Parameters:
        accept - flag indicating if accepted or not
        hashKey - the Software Agent's hash key

      • getNmapResults

        public void getNmapResults()
        Fills the cache memory with the nmap results.

        The results are stored in Cache.resultMap.

      • getXmlResults

        public void getXmlResults()
        Fills the cache memory with the xml results.

        The results are stored in Cache.xmlMap.

      • getAllNmapResults

        public java.lang.String[][] getAllNmapResults(java.lang.String timeFrom,
                                     java.lang.String timeTo)
        Gets the all the nmap results filtered by the received time range.
        Parameters:
        timeFrom - the lower bound of time range
        timeTo - the upper bound of time range
        Returns:
        all the nmap results

      • insertNmapResult

        public void insertNmapResult(int idNmapJob,
                    java.lang.String xml,
                    java.sql.Timestamp time)
        Inserts the nmap result into the database and cache memory.
        Parameters:
        idNmapJob - the nmap job id
        xml - the result in XML
        time - the time which the result was received

      • addToList

        public WrapperList addToList(java.lang.String columnName,
                    java.lang.String data,
                    WrapperList results)
        Adds the to list.
        Parameters:
        columnName - the column name
        data - the data
        results - the results
        Returns:
        the list

      • unmarshallXml

        public WrapperList unmarshallXml(java.lang.String xml)
        Unmarshall xml result.
        Parameters:
        xml - the XML result for unmarshalling.
        Returns:
        the results list

      • acceptORdeclineAndroid

        public void acceptORdeclineAndroid(boolean accept,
                          java.lang.String username)
        Accept or decline an Android user account

        The account:

        • gets deleted from Cache.pendingAndroid.
        • if accepted, becomes active and stored in Cache.acceptedAndroid.
        • if declined, gets deleted from database.
        Parameters:
        accept - flag indicating if accepted or not
        username - the username of the user account

      • getAndroid

        public void getAndroid()
        Fills the cache memory with the Android user accounts.

        The user accounts are stored in Cache.pendingAndroid or in Cache.acceptedAndroid depending on the condition of the account (active or not).

      • registerUser

        public boolean registerUser(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password)
        Inserts the Android user account into the database and cache memory

        The new account:

        • is considered inactive.
        • is inserted in the Cache.pendingAndroid .
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user account
        password - the password of the user account
        Returns:
        connected a flag indicating whether the registration was successful or not
